description:
Redevelopment by the erection of a new building comprising
sub-basement, basement, ground and five upper floors, the
lower part of the building for D1 (education) use as an
extension to RADA premises adjacent at 18 Chenies Street,
and first - fifth floors in C3 (residential) use for the
provision of 4 x 3 bedroom flats, 3 x 2 bedroom flats, and 5
x 1 bedroom flats,
as shown on drawing numbers  5790-1; -2; -3; -4; -5; -6; -7;
-8; -10; -11; -12; -13; -14  -9;  3024-P.00C;   /PO1 D;  /
PO2 E; /PO3 G;  /PO4 G;  /PO5 H;  /PO6 K;  /P+O7 H;  -P.08
D;  -PO9E; -P.10 F;  -P.11 G;  -P.12 D;  -P.14 D;  -P.15 D;
-P.16 C;  /P17E;  and P18F.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the [layout, sections, elevations and facing materials] to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. [Such details shall include proposed slab levels of the building in relation to the existing and proposed levels of the site and the surrounding land.] These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - Detailed works of sound insulation to the building shall be
    submitted to and approved by the Council and fully
    implemented before the use hereby approved is commenced.

Condition : 3 - No construction shall take place until a detailed design
    method statement for all foundations and other development
    more than 3 metres below ground level, which takes account
    of the proposed running tunnels of the Chelsea-hackney line,
    including any ground movement arising from the construction
    and operation of the said project, has been submitted to and
    approved by London Underground Ltd.

Condition : 4 - All plant including lift motors and any extract ventilation
    between these levels shall be at least 10dB(A).
    system shall be provided with acoustic isolation to prevent
    the transmission of noise and/or vibration to any other part
    of building and adjoining premises. This should be carried
    to ensure that at 1 metre outside the windows of the nearest
    habitable room the level of noise shall be at all times at
    least 5 decibels below the existing ambient noise levels
    expressed in dB(A), at such locations. Where the noise from
    the plant and machinery is tonal in character the difference

Condition : 5 - No music shall be played on the premises in such a way as to
    be audible within any adjoining premises or on the adjoining
    highway.

Condition : 6 - The use hereby permitted shall not begin until full details
    of the scheme for the ventilation of and the extraction of
    fumes from the premises to an adequate outlet level,
    including details of sound attenuation for any necessary
    plant have been submitted to and approved by the Council and
    the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in
    accordance with any approval given.

Condition : 7 - Details of the provision for access for disabled persons in compliance with the provisions of Section 4 of the Chronically & Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 and the 1985 Building Regulations (as amended by the Building (Disabled People) Regulations 1987) shall not be otherwise than as shall have been approved by the Council before any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 8 - The area for the storage of bikes hereby approved shall be
    provided and permanently retained.

Condition : 9 - The roof terrace planter shall be constructed as shown on
    approved drawings prior to the commencement of the use of
    the terrace, and shall be retained thereafter.

Condition : 10 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN13, EN14, EN16 and EN18 of
    the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 11 - In order to safeguard the amenity of adjoining occupiers.

Condition : 12 - To safeguard the operation of the Chelsea- Hackney line
    project.

Condition : 13 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000.

Condition : 16 - In order to ensure compliance with the terms of the Act and
    Regulations in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE3 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000

Condition : 17 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000.

Condition : 18 - Works of construction and ancillary activities, including
    deliveries, shall not take place other than between the
    hours of 0800 to 1800, Monday to Friday, and the hours of
    0800 to 1300 on Saturday, noisy works shall no be carried
    out on Sundays or bank Holidays in order to safeguard the
    amenity of adjoining occupiers.

Condition : 19 - In good time, prior to the start of construction (or if
    appropriate, demolition) on site, the contractor shall
    discuss and agree with the Council's Traffic Management
    Service (tel:020-7974 5629) detailed arrangements for
    the transportation of goods and materials to and from the
    site. The Council will prosecute those responsible for
    any breaches of the provisions of the Highways and Litter
    Acts which occur as a result of construction on the site.

Condition : 20 - In good time, prior to construction on site, the contractor
    shall discuss and agree with the Council's Engineering
    Service the appropriate threshold levels for all access
    points on the boundaries of the site with the public
    highway. The section dealing with these matters is Highways
    at Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street, WC1H 8EQ. (tel: 020-
    7278 4444)

Condition : 21 - Your attention is drawn to the requirements of Sections 7
    Disabled to Educational Buildings" published on behalf of
    the Secretary of State.
    and 8 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970
    (in respect of educational buildings) which requires that
    appropriate provision shall be made for access to the
    building for people with disabilities and that signs shall
    be displayed outside the building indicating that provision
    is made and, within the building, the location of the
    provision, together with appropriate routes. Guidance is
    provided in Design Note 18 "Access for the Physically

Condition : 22 - Your proposals may be subject to control under the Building
    Act 1984, the Building Regulations and the London Building
    Acts: 1930-82, and you are advised to consult the Council's
    Streets Management Building Control Service, located at
    Camden Town Hall Argyle Street, WC1H 8EQ. (Tel: 020 7974
    6941)

Condition : 23 - Your attention is drawn to the need to consult the Council's
    Waste Management Service, Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street
    London, WC1H 8EQ, (tel:020 7278 4444) regarding arrangements
    for the disposal of refuse.

Condition : 24 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939 (IH07)

Condition : 25 - The development hereby approved may be subject to the
    Executive Infoline (tel.0514 545500)
    Construction (Design and Management) Regulations 1994 which
    govern health and safety through all stages of a
    construction project. The Regulations require clients  (ie.
    those, including developers, who commission construction
    projects) to appoint a planning supervisor and principal
    contractor who are competent and adequately resourced to
    carry out their health and safety responsibilities. Further
    information is available from the Health and Safety

Condition : 26 - Your attention is drawn to the Council's Good  Contractor's
    Guide.

Condition : 27 - In order to ensure compliance with the requirements of
    Development Standard DS10 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan.
